title: Besides Queen's Bohemian Rhapsody, what other songs don't have a chorus? - Quora

response.answer_text: Bohemian Rhapsody isn’t the only popular song without a chorus. It is an unusual song, because its form is unusual. The word “rhapsody” hints at this. Instead of having two or three main tunes, it keeps unfolding into new material. There is a word for this structure in German - durchkomponiert- which is rendered in English as “through-composed.” Here are some Beatles’ songs without a chorus: A Hard Day’s Night And I Love Her Norwegian Wood Here, There and Everywhere When I’m 64 Honey Pie Each of these songs has verses and a bridge, but no chorus (Honey Pie and Here, There and Everywhere also have introductions. ) If I Fell is also like this. Its form can be outlined thus: Introduction Verse 1 Verse 2 Bridge Verse 3 Bridge Verse 4 Coda [ending]  Tom Jobim’s song, The Girl from Ipanema also has a verse verse bridge verse format:  But some songs that have this same form Tune 1 (Tune 1 again) Tune 2 Tune 1 (also known as ABA or AABA) do have a chorus. One example of this is Puttin’ On the Ritz, which has a repeated chorus and a changing bridge, functioning as a verse.

You might notice that “Bohemian Rhapsody” is a song of many flowing sections, and doesn’t repeat many, if any, phrases. This is why that song has no “chorus”. There are hundreds of songs without a chorus, including: “Paranoid Android” - Radiohead “Pinball Wizard” - The Who “Rap God” - Eminem “Wish You Were Here” - Pink Floyd “Thunder Road” - Bruce Springsteen “All Along the Watchtower” - Jimi Hendrix “Subterranean Homesick Blues” - Bob Dylan “Drive” - R.E.M. “My Way” - Frank Sinatra

Lots of Bob Dylan songs don’t have choruses. His output from his “psychadelic period” (the mid sixties) is full of songs like Desolation Row, Just Like Tom Thumb’s blues, Queen Jane Approximately etc etc which are strings of verses without choruses.
George Michael: “Praying for Time” I mean, there are hundreds of them. Any through-composed song from about 1790 onwards doesn’t. “Bohemian Rhapsody” isn’t special.

There’s loads, and some are real classics Space OddityStairway to HeavenHey JoeSeven Nation ArmyBut two of the weirdest, and my favourites are: Are Friends Electric? Tubeway Army. One of the first truly popular synthesiser songs.  O Superman. Lurie Anderson Just over 8 minutes of pure strangeness
a lot. stairway to heaven, vanilla twilight, my way… ah sheesh, just find all of them here (might be a little outdated though): http://www.songfacts.com/category-songs_without_a_chorus.php

The Tragically Hip - ‘Nautical Disaster’ Just take a listen. No hook whatsoever. It just builds and builds. Recently deceased Gord Downie was a legendary song writer, eccentric performer, poet and Canadian Icon.
The Verve – ‘Bittersweet Symphony’ The Who – ‘Pinball Wizard’ Bruce Springsteen – ‘Thunder Road’ Bob Dylan – ‘Subterranean Homesick Blues’
